Couched In Kindness: "Jakucho Setouchi: a revered nun and famous novelist " Aeon Magazine. . Setouchi was known for her biographical novels written as first-person narratives. She is known for her 1998 translation of The Tale of Genji. She was awarded the Women's Literary Prize in 1963 for Natsu no Owari. Setouchi died of heart failure in Kyoto, Japan, on 9 November 2021, at the age of 99. ==Prizes== * 1962 Women's Literature Prize for Natsu no Owari * 1992 Tanizaki Prize for Hana ni Toe * 2001 Noma Prize in literature for Basho * 2006 Order of Culture of Japan ==Works== * Joshidaisei Chu Airin (1957) Qu Ailing the Coedâ€”received the Shinchosha Coterie Magazine Award * Miren (1963) Lingering Affections * Kiji (1963) Pheasant translated by Robert Huey in * Beauty in Disarray translated by Sanford Goldstein and Kazuji Ninomiya * Natsu no owari (1963?)
